sources.data_found: Lists detailed specifications for GPU nodes on Notchpeak, Redwood, and Kingspeak clusters. Identifies H100, A100 (40/80GB), V100, and RTX nodes. Specifies 'Guest' access policy.
Overview of active clusters (Notchpeak, Redwood, Kingspeak, Lonepeak). Confirms usage of NVIDIA H100, A100, V100, and RTX architectures.
Official Fall 2024 Enrollment Census Dashboard. Filtered by College of Engineering -> School of Computing.

student_data.notes: Data retrieved from OBIA dashboard filtering for College of Engineering > School of Computing. 'Undergrad' includes Computer Science BS, Computer Engineering BS, and Data Science BS (managed by CS). 'Grad' includes MS in Computer Science and Computing. 'PhD' includes PhD in Computer Science and Computing.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Listed in Notchpeak specifications (8 nodes x 4 GPUs).
Listed in Notchpeak specifications (12 nodes x 4 GPUs).
Listed in Notchpeak specifications (22 nodes x 4 GPUs).
Legacy nodes in Notchpeak/Kingspeak (30 nodes x 4 GPUs).

gpu_resources.notes: GPU counts derived from Center for High Performance Computing (CHPC) active node lists. CHPC operates on a condominium model with a 'guest' partition allowing preemptable access to owner nodes. Calculations based on listed node configs: H100 SXM (2 nodes x 8 GPUs), A100 80GB (14 nodes x 4 GPUs), A100 40GB (3 nodes x 4 GPUs), L40S (4 nodes x 4 GPUs), V100 (11 nodes x 4 GPUs). A40 count (8) derived from Redwood cluster specs (2 nodes x 4 GPUs). Consumer/Pro-Viz cards (RTX 6000 Ada, 4090, 3090) are heavily utilized for research.

compute_credits.description: CHPC provides a 'free tier' (guest queue) for unused cycles on owner nodes, but does not publish a specific USD value for these credits.

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI, Claude, and Gemini models. OpenAI failed to retrieve data; all metrics sourced from Gemini's detailed analysis of OBIA and CHPC documentation.
